dataset_id: Arctic Circumpolar Distribution and Soil Carbon of Thermokarst Landscapes, 2015
title: Arctic Circumpolar Distribution and Soil Carbon of Thermokarst Landscapes, 2015
summary: This data set provides the distribution of thermokarst landscapes in the boreal and tundra ecoregions within the northern circumpolar permafrost zones. This dataset provides an areal estimate of wetland, lake, and hillslope thermokarst landscapes as of 2015. Estimates of soil organic carbon (SOC) content associated with thermokarst and non-thermokarst landscapes were based on available circumpolar 0 to 3 meter SOC storage data.

citation: Bogard, M.J., C.D. Kuhn, S.E. Johnston, R.G. Striegl, G.W. Holtgrieve, M.M. Dornblaser, R.G.M. Spencer, K.P. Wickland, and D.E. Butman. 2019. Negligible cycling of terrestrial carbon in many lakes of the arid circumpolar landscape. Nature Geoscience. 12(3):180-185.

Heaster, J.D.2017. The Relationship between Wildfire Dynamics and Soil Carbon in Boreal Forests of Alaska: Forest Management for Emissions Reduction in a Changing Climate . University of San Francisco.

Olefeldt, D., S. Goswami, G. Grosse, D. Hayes, G. Hugelius, P. Kuhry, A.D. McGuire, V.E. Romanovsky, A.B.K. Sannel, E.A.G. Schuur, and M.R. Turetsky. 2016. Circumpolar distribution and carbon storage of thermokarst landscapes. Nature Communications. 7(1):
